name: Poached Egg and Chicken Salad with Korean Gochujang Vinaigrette
author: Steph Cha
summary: An easy salad jazzed up with a tangy hot dressing and dribbling poached egg.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon gochujang (Korean hot pepper paste), or to taste
directions: Whisk olive oil, sesame oil, brown sugar, 2 tablespoons vinegar, gochujang, and black sesame seeds together in a bowl
Cover vinaigrette with plastic wrap and chill
Mix chicken and spinach together in a large bowl
Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil
Reduce heat to bring water to a gentle simmer; add 1 tablespoon vinegar and salt
Crack each egg into an individual bowl or cup then gently slip into the water at 10- to 15-second intervals
Cook eggs until the whites are firm and the yolks have thickened but are not hard, about 3 minutes
Remove the eggs from the water with a slotted spoon, draining water, and place one poached egg on each salad
Drizzle vinaigrette over salad and serve
